Title: Captain Jonas
Description: Hello, I'm the captain of the city. You are elected for the new chieftain of this city.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: Our neighbor cities are fallen... We must not.

Title: Ghost Chief
Description: This city can't be saved...

Title: Ghost Chief
Description: I tried everything. I've given all for this city. But we are all doomed.

Title: Cook Maeve
Description: If we cook soup, we can feed more people.

Title: Cook Maeve
Description: If we mix in a little sawdust, the meals will feel fuller… but it’s not good for their health.

Title: Cook Maeve
Description: If we switch to simple gruel, we can feed more people… even if it’s far from satisfying.

Title: Cook Maeve
Description: We shouldn’t let anything go to waste… even the bodies of the dead. Using them would stretch our food further.

Title: Cook Maeve
Description: If we prepare tastier, more nutritious meals, it might lift everyone’s spirits and keep them going.

Title: Cook Maeve
Description: We could slip a few pills into their breakfast. It would make the workers push harder through the day.

Title: Medic Helena
Description: Some of our people won’t heal unless I operate… but the surgery carries an amputation risk. What should I do?

Title: Medic Helena
Description: I can keep the injured alive but our medical posts will fill up fast.

Title: Medic Helena
Description: If we fully use the facility, I can take more patients even if it means treating some on the floor. Do you allow it?

Title: Medic Helena
Description: If we give them extra rations, they’ll recover faster.

Title: Medic Helena
Description: A Care House would ease the strain on our medical posts and let me treat more people properly.

Title: Medic Helena
Description: If we start using triage, I can focus on the most critical cases first… but it won’t be without a cost.

Title: Sister Amara
Description: Our dead deserve a proper place to rest. A cemetery would give us the dignity to lay them to peace.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: We must decide how to handle the bodies. For now… covering them with snow is the quickest way to keep things orderly.

Title: Sister Amara
Description: A ceremonial funeral would honor the fallen… and remind the living of the strength we still share.

Title: Medic Helena
Description: If we take organs from the dead, we could save the living. It’s difficult to ask… but it may be our only chance.

Title: Inventor Silas
Description: If we use the bodies to fertilise the soil in our hothouses, the yield would improve. It’s unconventional… but effective.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: If we run emergency shifts, we can push our tasks through. It’s harsh… but the alternative is worse.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: If we extend the shifts, we’ll get more work done. It’ll wear them down… but output will rise.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: We could send the children to the safer workplaces. They’d help the settlement without facing real danger.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: We’re short on hands. Everyone who can work must go where they’re needed… children included.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: If we build shelters for the children, we can keep them safe while the rest of us work.

Title: Medic Helena
Description: If we teach the children basic medicine, they could help us care for the sick. It would make a real difference.

Title: Senior Engineer David
Description: If we teach the children engineering, they could help with future designs and lighten our workload in time.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: A Fighting Arena would give people a way to vent and distract themselves from the cold. It might lift spirits, even if briefly.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: When disputes flare up, we could settle them through a formal duel. It might keep the peace… in its own way.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: A Public House would give people a place to unwind after work. It could lift the settlement’s spirits.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Sir… after such punishing days, our people deserve every bit of relief they can find. A House of Pleasure would certainly provide it.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: A small amount of liquor could warm their spirits and ease the strain of these days.

Title: Sister Amara
Description: A House of Prayer would give our people a quiet place to practice their faith and find a moment of peace.

Title: Sister Amara
Description: If we build shrines around the settlement, they’ll give people quiet strength to face their work each day.

Title: Priest Elior
Description: If we gather in the shrine each evening, we can pray together and steady the hearts of our people.

Title: Sister Amara
Description: If we open Field Kitchens, we can give people hot meals that keep them warm and steady through the day.

Title: Medic Helena
Description: A House of Healing would let us care for the sick properly… and give them a place to pray for strength.

Title: Priest Elior
Description: A Temple would kindle hope in the hearts of the faithful… a light our people sorely need.

Title: Priest Elior
Description: If we form the Faith Keepers, they will patrol our streets and help keep the city faithful and safe.

Title: Priest Elior
Description: We must stand against wickedness. If the people denounce wrongdoing openly, the wicked will be brought to light.

Title: Priest Elior
Description: Those who stray must face public penance. It may guide them back to the right path and remind others to stay on it.

Title: Priest Elior
Description: If we proclaim you as the Protector of Truth, the people will see you as the one chosen to guide us through this darkness.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: If we build Watchtowers, we can keep the streets under guard and protect our people from troublemakers.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: If we gather everyone each morning, we can set the day’s tasks clearly and keep the city working in order.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: If we build Guard Stations, we can form an organised militia to keep peace and order throughout the city.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: We can form dedicated groups to keep the streets safe and maintain order throughout the settlement.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: If the Foremen patrol each work site, they can keep everyone focused and working as efficiently as possible.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: A Propaganda Centre would help us guide public opinion and keep the city aligned with our efforts.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: If we build a Prison, we can isolate those who threaten the stability of our city and keep the rest of our people safe.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: An Agitator would remind our citizens how vital their work is. The loudspeakers could push efficiency higher across the city.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: We can ask every citizen to pledge their loyalty. It would bind the city together under a single, clear purpose.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: If discipline in the Prison breaks, we may need to use force to restore order. It’s not a choice I take lightly.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: If the city fully embraces Order, we can guide every aspect of daily life and keep everything under control.

Title: Senior Engineer David
Description: If we research Steam Hubs, we can heat the streets the generator can’t reach. It would keep more of our people safe.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Placing Steam Hubs along certain streets would keep those areas warm and help people endure the cold.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Placing Steam Hubs along certain streets would keep those areas warm and help people endure the cold.

Title: Senior Engineer David
Description: If we research additional heaters, we can warm the buildings that don’t get enough heat from the generator.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Sir, if we place heaters in the medical buildings, we can keep the patients warm and help them recover faster.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Placing heaters in the Cookhouses would keep the food warm and help our people manage the cold better.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: If we build a Hothouse, we won’t have to rely solely on hunters. It will keep food coming even when the hunt fails.

Title: Inventor Silas
Description: Our latest harvest from the Hothouse was excellent. The yield is growing stronger each cycle.

Title: Inventor Silas
Description: All the crops in the Hothouse have died. If this continues, starvation may follow.

Title: Inventor Silas
Description: There’s a thief breaking into the Hothouse. Someone has been stealing our crops.

Title: Inventor Silas
Description: The crops died because a plague struck them… something we’ve never seen before.

Title: Inventor Silas
Description: We’ve examined the dying plants, and the plague is spreading faster than we expected.

Title: Inventor Silas
Description: The Hothouse is sealed. It will take several days before it’s safe to reopen… and until then, we’ll have no harvests.

Title: Inventor Silas
Description: The plague spread. Half of our people are gone… the cost of keeping the Hothouse running was far greater than we feared.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Sir, we should build hunter tents and send a hunter party to not starve.

Title: Hunter Nerisa
Description: Our hunting party… they’re gone. I’m the only one who made it back.

Title: Hunter Nerisa
Description: We’ve tracked something rare… a white deer. If we move fast, we might bring it down.

Title: Hunter Nerisa
Description: We chased the white deer through the frost… and we brought it down. Its meat will feed many.

Title: Senior Engineer David
Description: We’ve discovered a way to explore the surrounding areas. With the right preparation, we can send expeditions beyond the city.

Title: Explorer Harrow
Description: If we venture into the frozen world, we might find refugees… or resources we desperately need.

Title: Explorer Harrow
Description: We’ve found a group of refugees out there. They want to join our city… if we’ll take them in.

Title: Explorer Harrow
Description: A storm is heading our way. It will be effective for five days… and it looks brutal.

Title: Explorer Harrow
Description: We’ve come across an automaton and still functional. I can send it back to the city if you want it.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Sir, the storm is here. The whole city is bracing for what’s coming.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Many homes are freezing. People are falling ill faster than we can treat them.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: The deeper levels of the mines are frozen solid. Our workers can’t continue down there.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: We’ve lost people in the deeper floors of the mines. The cold down there was worse than we feared.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: I sent the workers home today. Forcing them to stay would’ve only led to more losses.

Title: Cook Maeve
Description: We’ve run out of raw food. With the hunters unable to go out, there’s nothing left to cook.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Sir, the storm has passed. The city can finally breathe again.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: The generator has gone cold… and the city with it. There’s no one left to save.

Title: Senior Engineer David
Description: If we study the automaton, we might improve its design or even build more of our own.

Title: Senior Engineer David
Description: The automaton malfunctioned… it crippled one of our people. We need to decide what to do about it.

Title: Senior Engineer David
Description: I'm making progress on the research about the automatons. I should keep going.

Title: Senior Engineer David
Description: If the workshop dedicates the whole day to automaton upgrades, we might make real progress but we stop all other work.

Title: Senior Engineer David
Description: The automatons are now running smoothly. Their efficiency has improved far beyond what we expected.

Title: Senior Engineer David
Description: If we build Workshop, we can speed up our research and push new ideas forward faster.

Title: Senior Engineer David
Description: If we craft prosthetics, some of the injured could return to work again.

Title: Medic Helena
Description: If we order prostheses, our amputees could regain the ability to work and a sense of purpose.

Title: Medic Helena
Description: We can’t afford to feed those who can’t work anymore… they may have to return to London.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: A Bath House would help prevent sickness. Cleanliness could spare our people from falling ill.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: There’s a fight breaking out in the Bath House. We need to act before it gets worse.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Sir, if we redesign the houses, we can give families more space in their living quarters.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: If we redesign the houses, we can make room for more people inside each one.

Title: Medic Helena
Description: If we build a Dispensary, we can use new experimental medicines to treat the gravely ill. It might save lives we can’t reach otherwise.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: If we enforce stricter safety procedures, people will work with less haste and greater care.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: If we require workers to clean and maintain their equipment, we can keep everything in safe operating condition.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: If we switch to shorter shifts, people won’t be overworked and they’ll make fewer mistakes.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: People are rested and working less. If we push them now, we can use their full potential.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: If we run two full shifts, we can accomplish our key goals twice as fast.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: If we run two full shifts, we can accomplish our key goals twice as fast.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: If we give extra rations to those working extended shifts, they’ll have the strength to keep going.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: If I coordinate the work between both shifts, we can reduce downtime and keep everything running smoothly.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Sir, the workers have begun forming their own council. They’re organizing among themselves… and it may challenge our authority.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: The Workers Council will represent the interests of the working people. They’re expecting us to acknowledge their voice.

Title: Workers Council Rowan
Description: I’m Rowan, leader of the Workers Council. We speak for those who keep this city standing.

Title: Workers Council Rowan
Description: If the conditions don’t improve, our workers can and will strike. They won’t suffer in silence.

Title: Workers Council Rowan
Description: We need a place of our own a hall where the Workers Council can meet and speak freely.

Title: Workers Council Rowan
Description: The workers are uneasy. If this continues, a strike is coming. But… for a fair price, I can calm things down.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Sir, if we don’t keep the Workers Council in check, they may go astray and undermine our authority.

Title: Workers Council Rowan
Description: Everyone should work wherever they’re sent worker or engineer, no exceptions.

Title: Workers Council Rowan
Description: Work must be done on time. If we want results, we sacrifice everything else. Efficiency comes first.

Title: Workers Council Rowan
Description: The Council will provide its own militia to ensure the workers’ security. We’ll look after our own.

Title: Workers Council Rowan
Description: We need an Execution Place… to deal with the enemies of the working masses.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: The engineers have begun forming their own council. They’re organizing separately from the workers now.

Title: Inspector Arthur
Description: I’m Arthur, the Factory Inspector. I oversee the safety and discipline of every workshop and assembly line in our city.

Title: Inspector Arthur
Description: I’ll be visiting the workplaces. A bit of oversight tends to motivate the employees.

Title: Inspector Arthur
Description: Competent and loyal workers should be promoted. It will set a proper example for the rest.

Title: Inspector Arthur
Description: We should build Security Outposts. They’ll ensure the safety of our employees while they work.

Title: Inspector Arthur
Description: Our best employees deserve better accommodations. Excellence should be rewarded properly.

Title: Inspector Arthur
Description: To maintain the level of efficiency we need, we should build a Penal Colony. Convicts can be put to work there.

Title: Inspector Arthur
Description: Guards from the outposts should ensure every employee returns to work. Discipline must be maintained.

Title: Inspector Arthur
Description: Troublemakers can be convicted without trial. It would keep order… and expand our workforce when needed.

Title: Inspector Arthur
Description: Convicts should be kept out of our health facilities. Resources must go to those who serve the city.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Someone left a note at the Care House… thanking us for building it. It seems it truly helped.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Sir, someone left a note at the Child Shelters, thanking us for building them. It seems they brought real comfort.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: One of the children was injured at work. Do we give them a day off to recover?

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: A mother refused to send her daughter to work. How should we respond?

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: People are demanding double rations for the children who work. They say it’s only fair.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Sir… a woman is sitting in the snow pit, holding her dead husband’s hand. She won’t leave him. Should we bury him now?

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: A man collapsed and died during the emergency shift. Do we end the shifts now?

Title: Steward Elias
Description: A man has died after a duel. The people are unsettled… and some are questioning the practice.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: One of the men assigned to the emergency shift has refused to work. How should we respond?

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: The emergency workers are demanding extra rations for all the overtime they’ve put in.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: The people you pushed to work harder are moving slowly now. They don’t believe we’ll survive this hell. Should we end the shift?

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: The workers you ordered to stay for the emergency shift returned to work without a single complaint.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: People are starting to question why we keep calling so many emergency shifts. Should we stop them for now?

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: The workers are exhausted from these extended shifts. Should we grant them a break?

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Someone took their own life in the House of Pleasure. The staff are shaken… and people are already talking.

Title: Cook Maeve
Description: There’s a drunken man shouting in the Cookhouse… saying there’s no hope left. He’s stirring everyone up.

Title: Cook Maeve
Description: There’s a drunken man shouting in the Cookhouse… saying there’s no hope left. He’s stirring everyone up.

Title: Cook Maeve
Description: There’s a drunken man shouting in the Cookhouse again… saying there’s no hope left. He’s upsetting everyone.

Title: Senior Engineer David
Description: One of our engineers wants to pursue Radical Treatment. He’s devised a method that could reduce the number of amputations.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: A man who’s lost his hand says he can’t work… and can’t pay for a house. He’s asking us to build a Care House.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: One of our men didn’t arrive for work today. He says the Faith Keepers blocked his way… trying to force him to change his beliefs.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Sir, some of the amputees are asking to work in the Cookhouse. They can’t return to the mines, but they still want to contribute.

Title: Inventor Silas
Description: An amputee was caught stealing from the stockpiles. He took materials to try making a prosthesis for himself.

Title: Medic Helena
Description: To save a patient’s life, I had to perform an amputation. They’ll survive… but they won’t be able to work anymore.

Title: Medic Helena
Description: One of our people is close to death. If we don’t remove the leg, we may lose him entirely.

Title: Medic Helena
Description: The man whose leg we removed is thanking us. He knows we saved his life.

Title: Medic Helena
Description: The man whose leg we didn’t remove… he’s died from gangrene. We couldn’t stop it.

Title: Priest Elior
Description: Many are joining our prayers now. The city feels lighter… happier, even.

Title: Senior Engineer David
Description: The engineer who pursued Radical Treatment has reported success. His method works.

Title: Priest Elior
Description: We’ve discovered a hidden stash of food. We’d like to distribute it among the people.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: People on the streets are arguing about the Faith Keepers and their methods. Tension is rising.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Our Steward says that people are really appreciate that we opened Field Kitchen for them.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: A dying man left a note. He wrote that he can die in peace… and that the city is in good hands, thanks to you.

Title: Priest Elior
Description: People have begun visiting the House of Prayer again. It seems they truly needed this place of peace.

Title: Sister Amara
Description: The execution platform near the generator is complete. Those deemed enemies of the faith will face judgment there.

Title: Priest Elior
Description: A family in the settlement still follows the old religion. They keep relics from their former faith.

Title: Priest Elior
Description: Some of our people say penance should be a choice, not a duty. They believe no one should be forced into it.

Title: Priest Elior
Description: Some of our people say penance should be a choice, not a duty. They believe no one should be forced into it.

Title: Priest Elior
Description: A man has brought us a long list of names… he calls them wrong-doers

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Sir… some of the faithful dragged an old man from his house, trying to force him to submit to their beliefs.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: A man has come forward saying his neighbors are planning a protest. We should decide how to handle it.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: A man has come forward saying his neighbors are planning a protest. We should decide how to handle it.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: A woman claims her neighbors are hoarding food and supplies. We should decide how to respond.

Title: Priest Elior
Description: A man from the family you allowed to keep their relics is frightened. Someone has marked their door with a red ‘X’

Title: Priest Elior
Description: The Faith Keepers are still going from home to home, collecting relics of the old religion. Some families are growing nervous.

Title: Priest Elior
Description: The Faith Keepers are still going from home to home, collecting relics of the old religion. Some families are growing nervous.

Title: Priest Elior
Description: A young girl told us her mother said to one of our Faith Keepers that he’s going to burn in hell. Word is spreading fast.

Title: Priest Elior
Description: A woman came to see you. She’s denouncing one of the Faith Keepers, saying he’s doing whatever he pleases to people.

Title: Priest Elior
Description: People have begun leaving their personal charms and beads at the shrines. It seems the shrines truly help keep their spirits up.

Title: Priest Elior
Description: A man from London told me his faith had died long ago… but after visiting the Temple, he says he can finally see a future again.

Title: Priest Elior
Description: The Public House is poisoning people’s minds. We should cut its opening hours before it leads them astray.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: One of the Agitators has been vandalized. Someone stripped parts from it during the night.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: A mother has come to speak with you. She says a group of children beat her boy.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Sir… the Wardens have been beating inmates in the Prison. One has died, and another is badly injured.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: People are protesting in front of the Prison. They’re furious about the inmates who died.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: A group of workers have started organizing their workplace on their own. They say it’ll make them more efficient.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: A group of drunk men are causing a disturbance. The peace is slipping.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: A child came to the Guard Station today and handed a small toy to one of our guards… saying he should carry it on his patrols.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: A prisoner insulted one of our guards. The guard struck him with his baton and knocked him out.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: A child climbed up the generator and slipped… but one of our guards caught them just in time.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: The guards discovered a frozen body. His coworkers tied him up as punishment… and left him to the cold.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: One of our citizens insulted the guards. They didn’t let it go… and now that man is in the medical post.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Sir… one of our people that protesting was beaten by the guards so severely that he’s close to death.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: A man is giving a speech to a small crowd… accusing you of failing the city.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: The guards report that a woman attacked them during their patrol. They’re asking how to proceed.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: An engineer was accused of trying to turn some workers against you… but he insists that isn’t true.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: The guard who knocked that man out is drunk. He’s chasing people through the streets and hitting them with his baton.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: One of our citizens is refusing to sign the Pledge of Loyalty. How should we respond?

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: A man was assaulted by his neighbor. She claims he informed on her and took matters into her own hands.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: One of our informants was attacked on his way home from the Cookhouse. Someone wanted to silence him.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: A woman was assaulted by her neighbor. He claims she informed on him, and he lashed out.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: Our guards have detained a man they suspect of disloyalty. They’re awaiting your decision.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: A man is openly protesting against the abuse within our penitentiary system. People are starting to gather around him.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: One of the prisoners is complaining about the cold in the cells. He says they can barely endure it.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: The prisoner who complained about the cold… we found him dead in his cell this morning.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: The prisoner who complained about the cold was taken to the medic. His arm had to be removed to save his life.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: One of our informers has been abusing her position… she’s blackmailing citizens for favors.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: A poet was found dead. His writings spoke of loss… and the death of hope.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: There’s been a terrible accident in one of our facilities. Almost an entire team of workers has been killed.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Sir, our medic reports an outbreak of venereal disease at the House of Pleasure. It’s spreading quickly.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Sir, people are still falling sick after visiting the House of Pleasure. The problem isn’t going away.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: People have started using the Bath House for… other things. It’s becoming a concern.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: Sir, people are frightened. Criminals roam the streets, and there’s no space left to hold any more prisoners.

Title: Priest Elior
Description: Our people wish to hold ceremonial funerals at the cemetery. They say it brings comfort and dignity to their grief.

Title: Medic Helena
Description: Our people wish to hold ceremonial funerals at the cemetery. They say it brings comfort and dignity to their grief.

Title: Medic Helena
Description: Several workers at the construction site passed out and fell into the machinery. The experimental drugs from the Dispensary caused it.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: One of the men died from overwork today. His record shows he was a rapist and a murderer.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: The guards have been sending some workers to Prison without trial men they call troublemakers. Now the people are protesting.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: One of the amputees refuses to go home. His company will stop paying him the moment he does.

Title: Priest Elior
Description: We should ban the demon drink. It affects our people negatively.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Sir, a worker woman suspected of attempted sabotage is complaining that a guard subjected her to an invasive body search.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: Some of the engineers working on the generator… they’re sabotaging it. We caught signs of deliberate damage.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: There’s a man who brings trouble to the workplace every morning. The others are tired of dealing with him.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: The guards want to speak with you. The workers keep stopping their tasks to protest instead of fixing the generator on time.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: A woman was caught stealing factory supplies. She’s complaining about the body search — says the older folks are never suspects.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: A friend of those troublemakers has been visiting them in Prison, reading their rights aloud. He will take it to the court in London.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: The workers want to choose their own representatives. They’re asking for your approval.

Title: Senior Engineer David
Description: Giving so much power to the Workers’ Council might be the end of the Generator. Their decisions could put everything at risk.

Title: Senior Engineer David
Description: Giving so much power to the Workers’ Council might be the end of the Generator. Their decisions could put everything at risk.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: The Workers’ Council is asking for a day off to celebrate the progress, but engineers disagree and want to finish the generator.

Title: Workers Council Rowan
Description: We’re demanding a Bath House. The workers need it and we expect you to approve it.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: That troublemaking worker… he’s suddenly disappeared this morning. No one’s seen him.

Title: Workers Council Rowan
Description: We’re asking for morning tea from the Cookhouse every day. The workers deserve at least that to start their shift.

Title: Workers Council Rowan
Description: We want religion banned in the workplaces. We don’t care what anyone believes the job must come first.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: A friend of those troublemakers is proposing that prisoners should work and paid half the usual instead of sitting in a cell.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: A group of workers attacked our guards with batons they stole from the Guard Station.

Title: Workers Council Rowan
Description: We’ve had a good meeting. The workers agreed everyone will put in extra work today.

Title: Workers Council Rowan
Description: One of the workers has an idea that could save resources while building the new structure.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: A fire broke out at the construction site. Several workers are injured and the damage is severe.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Sir, one of the engineers is shouting near the generator… saying he has a degree, yet he’s still being sent to the mines.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: The workers want to celebrate a ‘Day of the Generator.’ They say it deserves its own moment.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: A worker lost his temper and slapped a guard. The guard is demanding punishment.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: A shipment arrived from the main city fine tobacco. Should we share it with the workers?

Title: Inspector Arthur
Description: We need overseers to supervise the engineers. With proper oversight, the work can be done without mistakes.

Title: Inspector Arthur
Description: I’m demanding we change the Agitator slogans to align with the engineers. It will keep the message consistent across the city.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: The Agitator is insulting the workers now… ever since the Inspector changed its slogans.

Title: Foreman Oswin
Description: The Agitator is insulting the workers now… ever since the Inspector changed its slogans.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Our people have been hungry for days. They’re eating so little… it’s starting to show.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Sir, our people have been starving for days. They’re demanding food right now.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: The workers caught the man they believe started the fire. They say he was seen near the site just before it happened.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: A worker assigned as a medic mixed the medicines wrong and poisoned the patients. He claims he was following the manuals the engineers provided.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Sir, people are growing concerned about the untreated sick. We may need more Medical Posts.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: We need more Medical Posts if we want to treat all of our people properly.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Sir… our people are dying in the streets. We need new Medical Posts, or we won’t keep up.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Some of our people are worried about their cold homes. They could fall sick any day now.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Sir, some of our people are falling ill because their homes are freezing. They can’t endure much longer.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: People are growing angry about the cold houses. If we do nothing, they’ll start dying.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Some of our people are worried about how cold their workplaces are. They could fall sick at this rate.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Some of our people are refusing to come to work because of the cold. They say it’s unbearable.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: People are growing angry about the cold workplaces. If we do nothing, some of them may start dying.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Some of our people are sleeping outside. They’ve nowhere warm to go.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: Sir, the people sleeping outside are falling sick. They can’t work like this… we need to do something.

Title: Steward Elias
Description: The people sleeping outside will die if we do nothing. The cold is already taking its toll.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: Chief, nights are getting restless. We should do more patrolling. It may scare people but will keep us safe.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: Chief, Patrol found a man collapsed in a side alley. He would’ve died out there. My men are waiting for instructions.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: The man we found in a side alley has thanked us for saving his life.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: The man we found in a side alley has thanked us for saving his life.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: We saw a dead body while patrolling the side alley. That was the man we found recently.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: Chief. A fight broke out at the supply depot during distribution. Guards can disperse the crowd.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: A man found dead after the fight at supply depot.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: Chief. A group gathered after hours near the generator. No violence yet. My men await orders.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: Chief, With injuries rising, I don’t have enough men to cover all routes tonight. I need you to choose what we leave unguarded.

Title: Captain Jonas
Description: Chief, A patrol caught someone stealing heating parts. He ran. We can chase or secure the remaining stock.

Title: The End of Hope
Description: Hope fades completely. The people stop believing in tomorrow, and your rule collapses quietly in the cold.

Title: Blinded by Hope
Description: Your promises grow too grand. Reality breaks beneath impossible expectations, and the city turns on you.

Title: Silent City
Description: No one resists anymore. The city grows eerily quiet as its people lose the will to react — or to live.

Title: Uprising
Description: Anger boils over. The streets erupt, and your reign ends amid fire, shouts, and broken authority.

Title: Lost Control
Description: Rules no longer matter. Without order, the city fractures, and leadership becomes meaningless.

Title: Iron Rule
Description: Your grip tightens too much. Fear replaces loyalty, and you are removed before the city breaks entirely.

Title: Faithless
Description: Belief crumbles. Without faith in anything greater, the people abandon you — and each other.

Title: Zealotry
Description: Faith turns fanatical. Devotion becomes violence, and you are consumed by the fire you allowed to spread.
